settings.question: How much is shipping?
settings.answer:
Shipping is $7 for ground service, $11 for 2-day delivery, and we offer FREE shipping for orders that include two crib sheets or more. 

We encourage you to purchase sheets for friends and family as there is no better gift than sleep!

settings.question: How do I return/exchange?
settings.answer:
Products that are unwashed and in their original packaging are eligible for return within 30 days of delivery.

To begin a return or exchange, please email sleep@petitsleep.com. We will provide you with a prepaid return label and ensure your return is processed ASAP.

Please allow up to 2 weeks for processing once your return is received and quality checked at our warehouse.

 Once your return is processed you will receive an email confirmation to the email address provided at the time of purchase.

settings.question: There’s something wrong with my order, what should I do?
settings.answer: Please contact us by email or phone, (248)-779-9201, so we can work with you directly. We will be sure to fix the problem ASAP.

settings.question: What are Petit Sleep Crib Sheets made of?
settings.answer:
Our Crib Sheets are 95% certified TENCEL™ Modal, 5% Spandex. 

Lenzing's flagship brand for textiles. TENCEL™ Modal is a super-soft sustainable knit made from the pulp of Austrian beechwood trees. Lenzing uses pesticide free wood to produce their fibers. They have acquired many acalades inlusive of climate pledge friendly certifications. The finished product is lightweight, breathable, cool to the touch, and durable enough to be machine-washed and tumbled dry. All of our dyes are nontoxic, AZO-, phthalate- and metal-free. We do not use flame retardants.

settings.question: How should I care for Petit Sleep Crib Sheets?
settings.answer: Wash on a cold, gentle cycle and then tumble dry low. Do not bleach. Wash in this manner in order to preserve the durability and strength of the fabric. Avoid snagging or damaging the fabric by avoiding washing with other clothing with snaps, buttons, Velcro, or zippers. Pretreat any spots with a product containing enzymes. Avoid clipping anything, including pacifier clips, to the fabric to avoid unintended holes. Store in an airtight container when saving crib sheets for your next child!
